results.title: Australia, Where Time Began
results.brief_description: Ravaged by time, wind, water and a scorching sun, the world’s most extraordinary landscape has evolved - a landscape of contrast, mystery and awe. This film is an explanation of how the deserts, salt lakes, monoliths, escarpments and gorges of the planet’s only island continent were created. It also portrays the endearing animals and plants which have adapted to an often hostile environment.

results.title: A Town like Alice
results.creator_credit: David Stevens, Henry Crawford and Crawford Productions
results.brief_description: Based on Nevil Shute’s best selling novel, “A Town Like Alice” is set against the brutal chaos of World War 11 and centres on two prisoners of war an Englishwoman, Jean Paget and an Australian soldier Joe Harmon, whose romance begins during the takeover of Malaya in World War 11 and takes them to the vast Australian outback.

results.title: Better Wine Enjoyment
results.brief_description: Better Wine Enjoyment By the Experts, takes the viewer to Australia’s most famous vineyards, as well as some of the smaller wineries, seeking out the secrets of good wine from the winemakers themselves. Presented by Collin Segelov, it starts with the history of winemaking in Australia and then moves to the art of growing the fruit and making the wine. results.title: Running out of patience
results.brief_description: In October 1986, Victorian nurses began an historic strike action which was to last 50 days. This video is the nurses version of the dispute. Despite widespread condemnation mainly from the media, the nurses eventually won out for an appropriate career structure including significant pay increases. Actual strike footage together with nursing training films and old photographs explore vocational stereotypes and place the strike in the context of the current crisis in the health care system.

results.title: Women in the workforce
results.creator_credit: Elizabeth De Rome and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: The claim that sex is destiny is thought by many to be ludicrous, yet in practice, is this actually the case? The express purpose of this film is to promote discussion of and around the conscious and unconscious barriers women have to face daily in the workforce.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Elizabeth De Rome and Open Channel Productions

results.title: Mum's the word
results.creator_credit: Sarah Gibson, Carol Kostanich, Rose Street Films and Sydney Filmmakers Co-operative
results.brief_description: Looks at three single mothers living on social security benefits or pensions and how they maintain their family lives. These women raise fundamental questions about single parenthood and the Australian social security system.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sarah Gibson, Carol Kostanich, Rose Street Films and Sydney Filmmakers Co-operative

results.title: Hal Porter
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia Council archival film series: writers I”.
A witty, biting commentary about life and an author’s place in it. Hal Porter reminisces about teaching, acting, producing for the theatre, and his life in Melbourne, Bairnsdale and Japan.

results.title: Christina Stead
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia Council archival film series: writers I”.
In the only filmed interview with one of Australia’s most popular and respected novelists, Christina Stead is both challenging and revealing.

results.title: Marjorie Barnard
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia Council archival film series: writers I”.
Historical novelist, Marjorie Barnard recalls priceless memories of fellow writers who “peopled her world”, including Xavier Herbert, Vance and Nettie Palmer and Frank Dalby Davison.

results.title: Gwen Harwood
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia Council archival film series: writers I”.
A charming film of poet Gwen Harwood speaking at her home in Tasmania about her work in poetry and her love for music and opera.
